etymologies: mid 16th century: apparently an alteration of French tortue (see tortoise)

definitions: a slow-moving reptile, enclosed in a scaly or leathery domed shell into which it can retract its head and thick legs.

notes.text: Family Testudinidae: numerous genera and species, including the European tortoise (Testudo graeca)

shortDefinitions: slow-moving reptile, enclosed in scaly or leathery domed shell into which it can retract its head and thick legs

definitions: a large marine reptile with a bony or leathery shell and flippers, coming ashore annually on sandy beaches to lay eggs.

notes.text: Families Cheloniidae (seven species) and Dermochelyidae (the leatherback)

shortDefinitions: large marine reptile with bony or leathery shell and flippers

definitions: the flesh of a sea turtle, especially the green turtle, used chiefly for soup.
shortDefinitions: flesh of sea turtle used chiefly for soup

crossReferenceMarkers: Called terrapin in South Africa and India and tortoise in Australia
definitions: a freshwater reptile related to the turtles, typically having a flattened shell.

notes.text: Order Chelonia: several families, in particular Emydidae and Kinosternidae

definitions: any reptile of the order Chelonia, including the terrapins and tortoises.
shortDefinitions: any reptile of this order, including terrapins and tortoises

definitions: a directional cursor in a computer graphics system that can be instructed to move around a screen.
shortDefinitions: directional cursor in computer graphics system that can be instructed to move around screen
